subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 30 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Liverpool to land £26.5m Torres
Liverpool are close to completing a deal to sign Atletico Madrid's Fernando Torres, BBC Sport understands.



 
Saunders is new Wales number two
Former international striker Dean Saunders is appointed assistant manager of Wales.



 
Everton pondering swoop for Smith
Everton may enter the battle to sign Man Utd's Alan Smith if he is allowed to leave Old Trafford.








GOLF




Khan maintains French challenge
Essex's Simon Khan is a shot behind  French Open leader Soren Hansen going into the final round.



 
Injured Wie quits US Women's Open
Michelle Wie withdraws from the US Women's Open with a recurrence of her wrist injury.



 
Mystery ailment hits Van de Velde
Jean van de Velde looks unlikely to feature in the Open after pulling out of international final qualifying with a mystery illness.








MOTORSPORT




Massa edges out Hamilton for pole
Ferrari's Felipe Massa takes pole for Sunday's French Grand Prix - McLaren's Lewis Hamilton claims second place on the grid.



 
Speedy Rossi takes Dutch victory
Valentino Rossi cuts the gap on Casey Stoner at the top of the MotoGP standings with victory in Holland.



 
French GP qualifying as it happened
Felipe Massa beats Lewis Hamilton into second in qualifying ahead of the French Grand Prix at Magny-Cours.








FORMULA ONE




Massa edges out Hamilton for pole
Ferrari's Felipe Massa takes pole for Sunday's French Grand Prix - McLaren's Lewis Hamilton claims second place on the grid.



 
French GP qualifying as it happened
Felipe Massa beats Lewis Hamilton into second in qualifying ahead of the French Grand Prix at Magny-Cours.



 
Ferrari head McLaren in practice
Felipe Massa leads the way as dominate Friday practice at the French Grand Prix, with McLaren Lewis Hamilton some way behind.








ATHLETICS




Weather could wreck Pavey's bid
Jo Pavey may pull out of the BMC Nike Grand Prix because of the weather despite needing to make the World Championship 10,000m qualifying time.



 
Wanjiru gets set for Tyneside run
World half marathon record holder Sammy Wanjiru is confirmed as a participant in this year's Great North Run.



 
Celtic Cup gets McConnell backing
Scotland captain Lee McConnell is looking forward to the second Celtic Cup event on 31 July.








CYCLING




Brit Cavendish claims Tour spot
Britain's Mark Cavendish is named in T-Mobile's nine-man team for the Tour de France.



 
Wiggins seals Tour de France spot
Britain's Bradley Wiggins is named in Cofidis' nine-man team for next month's Tour de France.



 
Kessler suspended by Team Astana
German rider Matthias Kessler is suspended by his team after testing positive for excessive levels of testosterone.








FUN AND GAMES




Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport



 
Zombie Brown's alternative Cabinet
Robbo picks the sporting icons who could do a job



 
Quotes of the Week
Thierry Henry is gunning for Barcelona, plus Jose Mourinho gets fruity
